data.title: Frank Lebby Stanton
data.text:
Frank Lebby Stanton Elementary School, often referenced as the "hope on the hill", is a small community school nestled in the thriving metropolis of Atlanta. Located just north of I-20 and west of I-75, the school is named after the late Frank Lebby Stanton, Sr., a noted American Lyrists and professional columnist for the Atlanta Constitution and the first Poet Laureate for the state of Georgia.

Frank Lebby Stanton Elementary School is a collaborative culture with a diverse staff that offers quality instruction in a culturally responsive environment embodying the beliefs and values of Atlanta Public Schools.

Why Frank Lebby Stanton Elementary School?
